snippet: China’s ambitious civil servants are increasingly — if discreetly — seeking supernatural shortcuts to wealth and power, much to the dismay of the Communist Party.
abstract: China’s ambitious civil servants are increasingly, if discreetly, seeking supernatural shortcuts to wealth and power, much to the dismay of the Communist Party; as Marxist ideology has faded in China, ancient mystical beliefs like geomancy, astrology, numerology and feng shui, once banned by the Communist Party are gaining ground.

byline.contributor: Shi Da and Sue-Lin Wong contributed research.

lead_paragraph: China’s ambitious civil servants are increasingly — if discreetly — seeking supernatural shortcuts to wealth and power, much to the dismay of the Communist Party.

headline.seo: Feng Shui Grows in China as Officials Seek Success
headline.main: China Officials Seek Career Shortcut With Feng Shui
headline.print_headline: China Officials Find Comrade In Feng Shui
